page.title: 10YOUTH HOSTEL,D.ABBOTS
page.content: The joint-wardens have lived in the village for 8 years and work from 7.30-12 and from 5-11pm in the Hostel. The building was originally a Rectory ,built in the 1860's.It has 18 rooms altogether but only 7 bedrooms are used by customers. The Hostel offers cheap accomodation for any people out and about in the countryside. Up to 60 people can stay overnight, some are self-catering. At least half the business is school parties from Birmingham,Bristol and Nottingham. People arrive by coach ,on a bicycle or on foot.One night's stay costs Â£3.80 for those under 16 and Â£4.85 for over 16 years old.The Hostel is set in 2.3 acres of ground part of which is vegetable garden and part can be used for camping. 85% of guests have meals cooked for them on a solid fuel Aga by the female joint-warden.
